oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Record Review Artist Interviews # 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recordings of phone interviews with various artists hosted by Al Rosen and Skip Woolwine. Recording features: Karen Brooks, Janie Fricke, Buck White, Lee Greenwood, John Conlee, Crystal Gayle, Conway Twitty, and Ronnie Milsap. Item is listed as part 2 of the Nashville Radio Review artist interviews.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Al Risen; Skip Woolwine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Karen Brooks addresses Skip Woolwine -- (00:05) Al Risen introduces Karen Brooks who discusses her personal interests -- (01:31) Risen and Brooks discuss how Brooks came to record with T. G. Sheppard through RCA Records -- (02:15) Brooks reflects on her work on the Thorn Birds (miniseries) -- (03:05) Risen and Brooks joke about the success of "Shame on the Moon" -- (03:35) Brooks reflects on the first time she heard "Faking Love" -- (04:00) Risen radio spot introduction for "Faking Love" -- (04:07) Risen looks to ask Brooks a question [incomplete] -- (04:10) Risen introduces Janie Fricke and both discuss Fricke's Female Vocalist of the Year Award -- (05:11) Risen and Fricke discuss Fricke's husband Randy Jackson -- (06:20) Fricke's work with Alabama is discussed -- (06:49) Fricke reflects on her upcoming studio work -- (07:02) Risen and Fricke reflect on "You Don't Know Love" and how Bill Warren sings harmony on the track -- (07:45) Risen radio spot introduction of "You Don't Know Love" -- (07:50) Risen introduces the Whites' Buck White, and White reflects on the luck associated with their success -- (09:28) White and Risen discuss what it is like to have Ricky Skaggs produce the Whites -- (10:23) White reflects on the upcoming plans for the Whites -- (11:01) Risen introduces "I Wonder Who's Holding My Baby Tonight," and White reveals that a fellow church-goer wrote the tune -- (11:40) Risen radio spot introducing "I Wonder Who's Holding My Baby Tonight" -- (11:47) Risen introduces Lee Greenwood, and Greenwood reflects on his recent works -- (12:48) Greenwood and Risen discuss Greenwood's wife's dancing career -- (13:16) Risen introduces "Love Song," and Greenwood reflects on how he wrote it originally for Kenny Rogers -- (14:06) Greenwood discusses his upcoming album release schedule -- (14:20) Risen introduces "Ain't No Trick," and Greenwood reveals how it was never supposed to be a single -- (15:02) Risen radio spot introduction of "Ain't No Trick" -- (15:06) Skip Woolwine introduces John Conlee, and Conlee reflects on his winter schedule -- (16:04) Woolwine introduces the Nashville Network and Conlee discusses the shows the group had already recorded for the Nashville Network -- (16:32) Woolwine and Conlee discuss Conlee's desire for radio work -- (17:40) Woolwine and Conlee discuss how Sammy Johns wrote "Common Man," and both discuss the upcoming album release schedule -- (18:44) Woolwine radio spot introduction of John Conlee -- (18:48) Risen introduces Crystal Gayle and both reflect on the beauty of "Until I Gain Control Again" -- (19:40) Gayle praises Kenny Rogers, and Gayle reveals her wish to tour with her sister Loretta Lynn -- (20:53) Gayle reflects on her process of decision making for records -- (21:22) Risen and Gayle discuss what Gayle does in her free time -- (21:48) Gayle reflects on the difference in recording "Our Love's on the Faultline" from her other tracks -- (22:15) Risen radio spot introducing "Our Love's on the Faultline" -- (22:21) [Large amount of low-end frequency played] -- (22:30) Risen says "OK?" -- (22:33) Risen introduces Conway Twitty, and Twitty reflects on the success of "The Clown" -- (23:01) Risen and Twitty reflect on Twitty's first television special -- (24:33) Risen inquires about whether or not Twitty would host another television special, and both discuss Twitty City -- (25:04) Twitty tells about the success of Christmas at Twitty City -- (26:18) Twitty reveals "The Clown" was brought to him, and Twitty reflects on how he tried to help the writers -- (27:51) Risen radio spot introducing "The Clown" -- (28:00) Risen thanks Twitty [incomplete] -- (28:04) Risen thanks Twitty [incomplete] -- (28:06) [Unidentified Voice] says "The delicious taste of the country" [incomplete] -- (28:08) Risen introduces Ronnie Milsap, and Milsap discusses his winter endeavors -- (30:18) Milsap discusses his ten-year anniversary with RCA Records -- (31:18) Risen introduces Mike Reed and his song "Inside;" additionally, Milsap reflects on Reid's musical talent -- (32:27) Risen radio spot introducing "Inside"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Woolwine, Skip; Risen, Al; Brooks, Karen (Vocalist); Fricke, Janie; White, Buck; Greenwood, Lee; Conlee, John; Gayle, Crystal; Twitty, Conway; Milsap, Joyce; Milsap, Ronnie, 1943-;
